title: Ruth Langsford blasts husband Eamonn Holmes for being "chauvinist" LIVE on air
text:

Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes are hosting This Morning in Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield’s absence. 
But things got a little tense this morning when Ruth, 56, slammed her husband for saying something “silly” and “chauvinist”. 
Talking to money expert Martin Lewis about credit cards, Eamonn, 57, dropped a real clanger. 
“Here’s something I wouldn’t want to do, shift my partner’s debt to my credit card,” Eamonn said, as Martin began to snigger. Eamonn Holmes admitted he wouldn't want his wife Ruth Langsford's credit card debt (Photo: ITV) Ruth slammed her husband's 'chauvinist' comments (Photo: ITV) 
“That’s a very silly, chauvinist kind of thing to say, isn’t it?” Ruth snapped. 
“Because I don’t have any debt on my credit card. I pay my credit card every month so take that back right now.” 
Eamonn retorted: “I would like to see the evidence of that darling, I’m not sure of that.” 
Riled Ruth insisted: “Have a look." Ruth insisted she doesn't have any credit card debt (Photo: ITV) 
Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield WON’T be presenting the show this week. 
The famous duo are set to be replaced when they take time off for half-term. 
Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes are set to takeover from Monday through to Thursday. 
Then Rylan Clark-Neal will step up for main presenting duties alongside Alison Hammond on Friday. Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield are taking a week's break from the show (Photo: Rex Features) 
Favourites Holly and Phil will be back in a week after the February half-term holidays. 
On the pair’s last show together before the break, Phillip presented Holly with her “very own unicorn” on This Morning to celebrate her 36th birthday. 
The ITV daytime show host thought she was ending the programme, but her co-host revealed it wasn’t the end yet. 
And, as her favourite song, Unicorns, I Love Them, from Despicable Me, played, she was presented with a unicorn by Gino D'Acampo. Read More Holly Willoughby Birthday Surprise (Photo: ITV) Holly Willoughby Birthday Surprise (Photo: ITV) Holly Willoughby Birthday Surprise (Photo: ITV) (Photo: ITV) Holly Willoughby Birthday Surprise (Photo: ITV) 
Well, “Tony the Pony in disguise”. 
Holly was so excited about the present, until he sneezed “all over her pink velvet shoes”! 
As Phillip was handed the unicorn, Gino then went out to wheel in a huge chocolate cake, complete with chocolate tequila shots! 
Gino explained you take the shot, and “then you eat it”! Read More Holly Willoughby Birthday Surprise (Photo: ITV) Holly Willoughby Birthday Surprise (Photo: ITV) 
And, as Holly took a shot, she said: “This is the stuff of dreams!” 
Happy Birthday, Holly! 
*This Morning continues on ITV1 weekdays at 10.30am Like us on Facebook
